p: Other important considerations concern the activity of PlL against Candida infections. PlL inhibits the growth of C. albicans and C. glabrata with low MICs. In addition, the prevention of arachidonic acid oxidation by COX-2 and LOX antagonism by PlL oil should be of interest for inhibiting the development of Candida biofilm and disseminations. Subsequently, PlL could act directly against the yeast and indirectly against its virulence, with no oral cytotoxicity.
